title: Muni Bond-Backed Fiberboard Plant Seeks Bankruptcy Restructuring
sub_head: California company says the road to converting rice-farming waste into a wood substitute ‘has not been smooth’
body:
A Northern California plant for converting rice-farming waste into a wood substitute filed for bankruptcy protection after work stoppages and cost overruns triggered a roughly $344 million municipal-bond default.
CalPlant I LLC said the road to converting rice-farming waste into fiberboard from a new plant in Willows, Calif., “has not been smooth” and sought protection from creditors in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Wilmington, Del., on Tuesday to look for a potential buyer.
